location.merchant_description_html: Brother and sister duo, Cindy and Peter Crossley are the most trusted hands in framing. Casual art lovers, serious art collectors and interior designers rave about their fast, reliable turnaround service. They’ve been expertly recommending high-quality mats, frames and shadowboxes for their clients since 2005. Whether you’ve got an original Warhol or a 2nd grade doodle, a treasured basketball jersey or an antique mirror, they can find a perfect way to display it. Visit the East Berkeley Street location or check out their new Waterfront space!

Brother and sister duo, Cindy and Peter Crossley are the most trusted hands in framing. Casual art lovers, serious art collectors and interior designers rave about their fast, reliable turnaround service. They’ve been expertly recommending high-quality mats, frames and shadowboxes for their clients since 2005. Whether you’ve got an original Warhol or a 2nd grade doodle, a treasured basketball jersey or an antique mirror, they can find a perfect way to display it. Visit the East Berkeley Street location or check out their new Waterfront space!

Take one bite of a home-cooked dish at Shoo Mama’s Farm Fresh Cafe, and settle in to stay awhile. The food here is local, farm fresh and cooked better than grandma’s. Try the Ralphie’s Mama panini stuffed full of smoked turkey, crispy bacon and provolone. Topped with bruschetta, this pressed piece of perfection pairs deliciously with Tot-Chos, a cafe specialty. Golden brown tater tots are smothered in spicy cheese, ground turkey and more nacho faves. You’ll shout out like a little boy did long ago, “Shoo Mama! That sure was good!”

Nestled into the neighborhoods of Brighton is the sweetest shop that all Bostonians need to try: Treats on Washington! Filled to the brim with pastries, sweets and savory eats, you’ll be hooked to this local gem after one visit. Stop in and savor a piping hot Chicken Pot Pie topped with a flaky crust. Enjoy a buttery, sweet Russian Tea Cake dusted with sugar, and a cup of Earl Grey for dessert. Take home a Peppermint Meringue (or four) to get you through the rest of the day. Homemade, delicious and your new addiction!

“There’s no place like Vinyl Wine Bar.” With three clinks of a long stem glass, you’re transported into a chic drink lair! You nestle into the plush couch and peruse the menu. Wishing for wine? Pinot Nior, Malbec, Prosecco and Spanish whites will make everything “poppy bright.” Banking on a brew? There’s 1960’s Schlitz lager, a West Coast IPA and the ever popular Hefewissbier. So who’s the Wiz in this tipsy tale? The man behind the grill cooking up award-winning charred pizza. Yes, it will change your life but take note: he only serves pies in-house on Thursdays!

Boston Kebab House is FiDi’s lunchtime hangout! Don’t be intimidated by a line that reaches the door, it moves quickly! Once you’re inside, take your pick. Is it a Sandwich Bar kind of  day (a Chicken Caesar Wrap never fails to please) or are you feelin’ the Salad Bar? Choose two proteins, unlimited veggies and enjoy! The fan fave is the Meze Bar. Load up a tray with delectable favorites like Baba Ghanoush, Artichoke Fritters and Humus. Your lunch break just took a turn for the better!

What’s better than being like “a kid in a candy store?” Being an adult in a liquor store. Each bottle holds golden ticket to a wildly wonderful night. Bottles of red and white wine glisten from their racks. Towering packs of foreign and domestic beer beckon from the freezer. A tour of the hard liquors section inspires you to make martinis, margaritas, even mixed drinks. Just because you’re 21+ doesn’t mean you can’t display a bit of youthful excitement now and again. Go ahead, let out a fist pump...then get out of here and get the party started!

When you think of City Feed and Supply, you’ve gotta think F.R.E.S.H. “F” is their Fair Trade organic coffee. “R” represents the Regional Artisan Cheeses that grace the aisles. “E” will remind you that the Eggs are free-range. When you think of “S,” the memories of warm Soups and local foods will have you craving. And finally, “H” is a beacon for Hot-Pressed Sandwiches (and cold ones too) like the Hummus & Harvarti with green pepper on foccacia. Natural foods, specialty groceries. It’s gotta be City Feed.

When you think of City Feed and Supply, you’ve gotta think F.R.E.S.H. “F” is their Fair Trade organic coffee. “R” represents the Regional Artisan Cheeses that grace the aisles. “E” will remind you that the Eggs are free-range. When you think of “S,” the memories of warm Soups and local foods will have you craving. And finally, “H” is a beacon for Hot-Pressed Sandwiches (and cold ones too) like the Hummus & Harvarti with green pepper on foccacia. Natural foods, specialty groceries. It’s gotta be City Feed.

Epicure by definition is a person with refined taste in food. For some reason, “refined taste” is synonymous with limited options. That is simply not the case at Epicure. Their ever delicious spreads pack some serious stats. On any given day there are 10 soups available. Be there on Butternut Squash Soup or Hungarian Wild Mushroom Soup day! If you prefer to bookend your lunch with bread, there are: 49 cold sandwiches, 3 hot sandwiches & 6 wraps. What are you waiting for? Start building out your refined diet! Mon: Rosemary Cured Ham Sandwich. Tue: Southwestern Grilled Shrimp Wrap...you could go on for at least 3 months without repeating!
location.merchant_name: Epicure Cafe & Caterers / The Fifth Avenue Epicure

location.merchant_description_html: Fresh Food Kitchen might as well call their dress code “scrub-casual.” It’s a hospital employee hot spot! Tired of redundant cafeteria reheat-eats, med-heads crave FFK’s fresh Indian plates. We’re talking Tandoori Chicken, Shrimp Kebabs and Vegetable Tawaa Masala. There are even to-go friendly options like fruit smoothies and panini sandwiches (served on addictive European flat bread.) Choosing Fresh Food Kitchen is a smart decision, but you don’t need an MD to eat here. This neighborhood fresh factory satisfies students, residents and corporate 9-5ers too!

When I went to the Art of Bread, I fully intended to bring home the goods. After I enjoyed my Tuna Genghis Kahn, with browned gruyere cheese, I was inspired. Why keep all the fresh-baked goodness to myself? At the counter I stocked up on tangy Apricot Tartes and smooth Le Bec-Fin style Cheesecake. As I pulled into my garage, the scent of fresh French baking overcame me. I devoured it in the dark. All of it. Then the garage light snapped on, and there are my kids, glaring. #CaughtFreshHanded #ButItWasWorthIt.

One sip of my Triple Truffle Cappuccino at Cafe One and I melted. How to explain it? It’s smoothly criminal. Once I bit into my Chicken Chipotle on Pita, blanketed in pepper jack, I let out an involuntary gasp. This is too good to be true, and too spicy not to share! Cafe One is social-media inspired: it’s the perfect space to network and vibe! So, screaming from the Twitter cybertops is so appropriate. Comment: “Me & my TTC and CC on P (we’ve got nicknames now) are killin’ it out here. Jealous tweets, accepted.”

Voltage Coffee dares Styrofoam addicts to dump their stale brews for made-to-order artisan lattes, served in warm ceramic mugs. “Get served” an Atticus Finch, a captivating vanilla latte infused with burnt sugar. Want a salty sip? Go Beyond the Sea. It’s a frothy delight loaded with homemade caramel and sea salt. The art isn’t limited to the foam leaves that baristas create in every cup. There’s local art at every turn. It provides an awesome backdrop to connect with friends or to hold a meeting. If your +1 is your laptop, snag the wifi code and hammer out a few e-mails to the beat of the soothing soundtrack.  Whatever the occasion, you’ll leave...Inspired. And Totally Wired.

I drop to my knees at Caffè la Stazione. I clutch my chest and squeak, “How’d you know…Nutella is my kryptonite?” When I saw the Nutella Latte (with a spoonful of hazelnutty goodness) I had to have it. I also grab an Il Fico Panini, dressed up with fig spread, parma prosciutto and Tallegio cheese. When I’ve inhaled all the deliciousness I can handle, I scan the room for enemies (someone had to know this was my weakness) but find only smiling faces. Caffè la Stazione is your weakness too. You just don’t know yet it.

Financial District dwellers, there’s a cornucopia of lunch options waiting at Buccieri’s Cafe!
They’re known for their made-to-order subs, homemade soups, and enormous salads. Sounds pretty simple...so...what’s their secret? They crank out hot, crispy, fresh baked bread on the regular! You’ll start any sandwich off right with a plank of homemade wheat or white. Start your BC allegiance with a loaded Hanover Street (an Italian stacker consisting of prosciutto, roasted peppers and sharp provolone) or an addictive Chicken Salad sammy!

The chefs at Stone Hearth Pizza have mastered the chew, crunch, char ratio in the thin crust of their Neapolitan style pizza, but the crust is not the only star in this oven. The sweet signature sauce, made with organic tomatoes mingles with the cheese and toppings in what we call a “crave-worthy collaboration.” Plus, a slice of this savory pie is just as good for your health as it is for your taste buds. The fresh, organic ingredients are sourced from 30 New England farms and businesses! Round up your family and friends and grab a seat at the table...there’s a fresh pizza with your name on it!

Ouch. You’re THAT kid…the one whose mom packed him a wack lunch and sent him to school to face the Lunchables. At least that’s what you look like next THIS guy… your co-worker who went to Al’s South St. Cafe for lunch. Al’s Bag Lunch is a winner: a soda, chips and any 10” sub or wrap for only $8.00! There are tons of choices ranging from a chunky Chicken Salad Wrap to a supremely seasoned Sicilian Steak sub, adorned with plum tomatoes and mushrooms. Come on guy! Grab your big boy lunch and let’s get to work!

Cajun Cajun in South Station is a one-way ticket on the flavor train, if you know what I mean. On my way home from work I grab a signature Bourbon Chicken, slathered in a special saucy blend. Sometimes I indulge in Shrimp Etouffee: brings me back to my Jock Jam days. Once I take a bite of that fresh shellfish and rice, I can’t stop from remixing my own version. “Way down south, flavor plays this game. This Jambalaya’s so crazy yeah we call it the train! Come on ride the train, it’s a Cajun traaain!” No shame.

Soupa Freak. Get Soupa Freaky now. Something funky has arrived in the San Fran. It’s a place boasting an entire menu made up of everyone's favorite cold-day liquid picker-upper: SOUP. Opt for a thick, meaty spoonful of Chili or a sip of it’s brothy brethren, the Lentil. This lineup is so flavorful and filling that the release of the Freak-O-Matzo caused panic-stricken Jewish mothers’ city-wide to cry “oy vey!” from the hilltops. Oy vey indeed! Accessorize a bowl of your favorite with a glass of Hibiscus Iced Tea or a fruity, bubbly homemade soda and you can become an official Soupa Freak. (Soupa Freak!)

As I sit in my dark dungeon of doom (my cubicle), I’m overcome with longing. Food. Light. Beverage. Now. I head for Blue Glass Café. Open to all Bostonians, this bright and airy spot is the perfect lunchtime refuge. Usually I go for the hand-rolled Spicy Crab Roll. Today, I switch it up and heap my plate with greens, heirloom beets and Smoked Turkey at the pay-by-the-ounce Health Bar. Before I leave, I spot the inspiration for my next escape: I’ll be back for the Starbucks coffee bar, for sure.

There are pizzas, and then there are cheese-laden culinary collaborations at Che’ Bella Pizza. Chili Cheese Fries? Genius. Sausage & Peppers Parmigiana? Bring it. The monster of all pizzas is the Mucho Meat: it’s piled with FIVE juicy meats (and comes with a hefty side of napkins!) Snag a Lasagna Pizza layered with ricotta and beef, and your tastebuds may be confused, but ultimately ecstatic. Plain pies turned positively palatable... we know you’ve got a magic wand in that kitchen, Che’ Bella. Trust... we’ll find it.

Columbia students: Next stop is the real world, so you’re pretty adept at decision-making by now, right? Ok, pop quiz. Should you... A) grab lunch at the same old cafe you hit up every day or... B) head nearby to Massawa for mouth-watering Eritrean & Ethiopian fare? If you answered “B,” you win! If not, you just passed up a sumptuous lunch of Tebsi beef cubes, sauteed with jalapenos and tomatoes. Ouch. I guess now’s probably not the time to add that the Monkfish is slowly simmered in lime and garlic. Ah, lesson learned.

Frustrated by the lack of SOMA lunch options, two friends opened AK Subs in 1994. 18 years later, the lunchtime migration to AK Subs for locally compiled omelettes, sandwiches, and salads is stronger than ever. AK newbies take one glance at the line and retreat. Little do the dropouts know, the AK crew has developed an impressively swift assembly system. In 4 mins, I’m at my final table destination unwrapping Tony’s Hot Pastrami Sandwich to reveal bacon-like meat, sliced thin and piled high. The towering treat is served on a toasted 3-seed roll with melted Swiss on top. At $6.91, juicy doesn’t even begin to explain it. Bottom line: get in line!

The panini is often misrepresented as a flatbread sandwich. Quit kickin’ it with fauxninis and score one of Panino Sportivo’s 60+ options! In this shop of soccer fanatics, you’ll hear shouts of, “P-13, please?” We’ll decode: the Giovanni, code name P-13, is drizzled in honey and stacked with pears and goat cheese. Try not to spill your Roma Gelato and a $2 Iced Coffee when your favorite team scores and you’re screaming, “Goaaaal!”

Tava is forcing you to rethink lunch. Forget the salad, throw away that pre-packaged soggy chicken salad sandwich (your body doesn’t want that anyways.) Introducing, the BURROTI. Nope, I didn’t mean burrito. I was referring to Tava’s unique Indian-styled wrap-up creation. Customize your fresh from the skillet Indian bread roti, with a protein like chicken or lamb, a sauce like tikka masala and a spectrum of spiciness levels. Roll it on up and devour! Your old lunch might miss you, but you won’t miss it.

Not your average deli or grocery. As the name would suggest, Apple Tree only rolls with the freshest goods for a health conscious New Yorker like you. They took a cue from the variety of culinary options in the big apple: Try the Godmother: roasted turkey, Swiss cheese, sliced avocado and tomato smothered with honey mustard on a hero roll. Satisfy midday hunger with the vast salad bar or freshly packaged sandwiches (some vegan!) for grab ‘n go lunch, and snag organic potato chips for the midnight munchies. Obviously, the apple doesn’t fall very far from the big apple tree.

I was cravin’ fresh lobsta, so I dug out my flippers. Issues: 1) The ocean is deceivingly cold. 2) I emerged prizeless and chattering. Then I saw it: The Cod Squad Truck! I hurried over. “S-s-Seafood ch-Chowder, please.” One spoonful and my insides warmed. Chock-full of freshness, I was deliciously surprised by the huge scallops submerged in creamy broth. I couldn’t stop. Corn & Crab Chowder, Clam Chowder, Lobster...I threw my flippers out. From now on, I’ll let the seafood come to me.

Great Scott! It’s no Wonder (Bar) that Inbound Pizza is a favorite among Brighton residents. It’s a convenient post-bar pit-stop on a Friday night. Danced out co-eds inhale chunky slices of cheese pizza, made with homemade dough and sauce right up until closing time at 2AM (Th-Sat.) Inbound is not only a late-night favorite, it’s also a delightful weekday dinner detour. Enormous turkey Club Paninis, kickin’ Buffalo Chicken Calzones, zesty jalapeno poppers and crisp curly fries are best enjoyed booth side. Hot tip: There’s a commuter cam, right above the counter that allows you to track the Green Line without waiting outside!

As a perfectly made Falafel, I love the spotlight. I’m crisp on the outside, and deliciously soft inside: I deserve to be the center of lunchtime attention at Falafel Bar. But sometimes, I must share the savory stage. I’m thrown into an all-star line-up of falafel, hummus, tomato & cucumber salad, tahini and pita for the ultimate Falafel Platter. For the encore, I perform a delightful duet of two food worlds: The Falafel Burger. Okay, it ain’t so bad sharing my shine. But, it must be a crime to be so damn delectable.
